channel.title: Blog on Geeky Blogs
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Geeky Blogs

item.title: Artificial Intelligence and Robotics In A Nutshell
item.description: Artificial Intelligence is an umbrella term and describes the broad approach of using machines to imitate intelligent human behavior in order to solve problems.

item.title: Drone Software and Development
item.description: Drones allow opening previously unavailable opportunities – to see the invisible and reach the unreachable – not only in the air but also on the ground and underwater.

item.title: Github Repository Controls
item.description: Github Tutorial: How to Make Your First GitHub Repository A critical skill for developers of all experience levels is proficiency in GitHub.

item.title: My work from home workstation
item.description: The Pros and Cons of Working from Home as a Web Developer The US Occupational Outlook Handbook estimates that by 2024, there will be a 27% increase in the job prospects for this kind of expertise, due to the increasing use of mobile devices and e-commerce.

item.title: Robots Transformimg our Future
item.description: “A robot is an autonomous machine capable of sensing its environment, carrying out computations to make decisions, and performing actions in the real world.

item.title: What is a Virtual Assistant
item.description: What is a virtual assistant? A virtual assistant is a virtual employee hired as an executive or administrative assistant for your business who works remotely.

item.title: What you need to know about Programming
item.description: What is Programming? We all have heard about Computer Programming gaining a lot of popularity in the past 3 decades. So many students these days want to opt for a Computer Science stream in order to get a job at their dream tech company - Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple, and whatnot.

item.title: Why you need to learn PHP
item.description: PHP is a popular programming language which is utilized to build dynamic web applications with MySQL database connections. For a programming language to be successful, it must be comfortable and widely accepted by a large number of web developers.
